content:
• Wednesday, January 9, 2019
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships +57% on $6M buyback program

    • Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) is soaring postmarket, up 57.2% on after-hours volume that's approaching its daily regular-session volume, following announcement of a share repurchase program.
    • The company's authorized buying back up to $6M in common shares.
    • Market cap at the close was just $11.5M.
    • Some 1.26M shares have moved since the close; recent regular-session volume is 1.65M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 19 Comments
  • UNP

    Union Pacific +1.8% as 2018 operations top expectations

    • In an SEC filing, Union Pacific (NYSE:UNP) issued an operational update where it says December carloadings were better than anticipated.
    • At November's end, the company said it didn't expect year-over-year improvement in its full-year operating ratio, due to slowing revenue growth and higher costs tied to severance and inefficiencies.
    • But the company now expects the ratio to land at 62.7%, a 0.1-point improvement from 2017, thanks to higher revenues, lower diesel fuel prices and improved cost performance.
    • “December carloadings were stronger than expected, led by international container imports,” says CFO Rob Knight. “We are also encouraged to see improved cost performance driven by early results from our Unified Plan 2020 implementation.”
    • Shares are up 1.8% after hours.
    • The company reports Q4 earnings before the open Thursday, Jan. 24, with a conference call to follow at 8:45 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 9 Comments
  • VERI

    VERI, BBBY, SNBR and LXFR among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: VERI +20.84%. BBBY +15.42%. ZUMZ +8.13%. EAF +7.89%. CASH +5.57%.
    • Top Losers: SNBR -10%. LXFR -3.79%. MIK -2.99%. SIGA -2.83%. WDFC -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM

  • Chinese yuan gains to strongest since August on positive trade talks

    • The offshore Chinese yuan rose to its strongest level since August after the U.S. and China wrapped up three days of trade talks on a positive note.
    • The U.S. dollar, meanwhile, slid to a three-month low.
    • The offshore yuan increased as much as 0.7% to 6.8074 per dollar in New York afternoon as volume was almost double its recent average, Bloomberg reports.
    • WisdomTree Chinese Yuan ETF (NYSEARCA:CYB) closed up 0.6% on Wednesday.
    • ETFs: CYB, CNY, DSUM, FXCH, CBON, KCNY
    • Previously: Chinese yuan slips after PBOC monetary policy comments (Dec. 28, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • COST

    Costco Dec. comparable sales top expectations

    • Costco (NASDAQ:COST) reports comparable sales increased 6.1% in Q4 to top the consensus estimate for a 5.7% gain.
    • The retailer's comparable sales (ex-gas, F/X) were up 7.1% in the U.S. vs 6.4% consensus.
    • Total sales rose 7.8% to $15.42B.
    • E-commerce sales rose 13.6% Y/Y during the month.
    • COST -0.43% AH to $209.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 13 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home moves up 5.7% after Q4 EPS beats estimate

    • KB Home (NYSE:KBH) surges 5.7% in after-hours trading after Q4 EPS of 96 cents increases from 84 cents in Q4 2017 and beats the average analyst estimate of 93 cents.
    • Q4 revenue of $1.35B, exceeds consensus estimate of $1.34B; compares with $1.40B in year-ago quarter.
    • The company "took a balanced approach in allocating the substantial cash flow we generated toward supporting our future growth, reducing our debt, and returning capital to stockholders through repurchases of our common stock," says Chairman, President and CEO Jeffrey Mezger.
    • Q4 average selling price declines 5% to $395,200, primarily due to a shift in geographic mix of homes delivered.
    • Q4 net orders fell 12% to 2,013; net order value declined 21% to $738.3M Y/Y.
    • Q4 cancellation rate flat at 28%.
    • Housing gross profit 18.1%, unchanged from year-ago quarter; adjusted housing gross profit of 22.8% slips from 23.5% a year ago.
    • Book value per share rises to $24.01, up $1.88 from a year ago.
    • Looking at 2019: Sees community count increase of 10%-15%.
    • Conference call at 5:00PM ET.
    • Previously: KB Home beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • VERI

    Veritone raises Q4 guidance; VERI +16%

    • Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) raises its Q4 revenue guidance to $10.7M to $10.9M (was: $9.3M to $9.7M), which would represent a 209% Y/Y growth at the midpoint.
    • The company attributes the boost to the strong performance of its aiWARE operating system.
    • VERI is up 16% aftermarket to $5.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond +21% after positive outlook

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) soars after the company discloses that it's ahead of plan with respect to its longer-term financial goals to moderate operating profit declines. The positive outlook took the sting off a miss with BBBY's comparable sales.
    • The retailer also backed 2019 EPS guidance of ~$2.00 along with its report.
    • Previously: Bed Bath & Beyond beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Jan. 9)
    • BBBY +21.43% AH to $14.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 42 Comments
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond beats by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $3.03B (+2.7% Y/Y) misses by $20M.
    • Shares +16.9%.
    • Press Release

  • CGIX

    Cancer Genetics readies stock offering; shares down 6% after hours

    • Nano cap Cancer Genetics (NASDAQ:CGIX) slips 6% after hours in response to its announced stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • TLRY

    Shortable shares scarce in Tilray

    • Short sellers have enjoyed healthy returns in over-priced and over-hyped pot stocks. The demand is apparently white-hot for shares to borrow, a perfect environment for skyrocketing borrowing costs considering the low inventory of available shares.
    • According to analytics outfit S3 Partners LLC, financing costs to short shares of cannabis producer Tilray (TLRY -4.3%) soared to as high as 900% today, meaning that it would cost nine times the share price to borrow the stock, heavily influenced by the fact that more than three quarters of its 76.5M outstanding shares are owned by an entity co-founded and chaired by CEO Brendan Kennedy.
    • Selected tickers: CGC, OTCPK:MJNA, ACB, GWPH, OTCQB:PHOT, OTCPK:CBIS, APHA, OTCQX:TRTC, CRON, OTCQX:CANN, OTCPK:ERBB, OTCPK:GRNH, OTCQB:PMCB, OTCQB:CVSI, OTC:FITX, MJ, OTCPK:HEMP, OTCQB:CBDS, OTCPK:BLOZF, OTCQB:KSHB, OTCQB:MSRT, OTCQX:SPRWF, OTCPK:AGTK, OTCPK:AMMJ, OTCPK:VAPE, HYYDF, OTCQB:GBLX, OTCQB:AERO, OTCQB:MCOA, OTC:HMLSF, OTCQB:CNAB, OTC:FSPM, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCPK:PLPL, OTCQX:MNTR, OTCPK:EDXC, OTCQX:THCBF, OTC:FSPM, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCPK:PLPL, OTCQX:MNTR, OTCPK:EDXC, OTCQX:THCBF, OTCQB:KAYS, OTCQB:ENRT, OTCPK:ENDO, OTCQB:NTRR, OTCPK:REFG
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 49 Comments
  • JNCE

    Jounce adds to rally, up 2%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Jounce Therapeutics (JNCE +2%) is up on below-average volume. Shares have rallied 72% since touching $2.66 on December 26.
    • 2019 expected milestones from its presentation at JPM19:
    • Three immunotherapies (JTX-2011, JTX-8064, JTX-4014) will be in the clinic.
    • JTX-2011: Preliminary progression-free survival and overall survival data expected in H1. Advance into Phase 2 development.
    • JTX-8064: File IND and launch Phase 1 development.
    • JTX-4014: Establish safety and RP2D.
    • #JPM19
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • PCG

    PG&E retains advisors to explore asset sales - Spark Spread

    • PG&E (PCG +5.6%) has hired Citi and Morgan Stanley to evaluate asset sales, and is weighing options including a sale of its natural gas local distribution unit, SparkSpread reports.
    • PG&E also lined up Evercore as advisor to its board and is said to be working with AlixPartners as a restructuring advisor, according to the report, which cites industry sources.
    • In response, the company says it regularly evaluates its structure, declining further comment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 8 Comments
  • EADSY

    Airbus order rate slipped in 2018 but still boasts huge backlog

    • Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY +4.4%) says it booked fewer airliner orders in 2018 and trailed rival Boeing (BA +1.4%) for the year but remains upbeat about global demand for air travel.
    • Airbus posted 747 net orders in 2018, down 33% from 1,109 in 2017, including 135 for the A220 jetliner which it took over from Canada's Bombardier in July, while delivering a company record 800 planes last year, marking the first time since 2009 that its deliveries outpaced new order bookings.
    • But the European planemaker exited 2018 with a backlog of 7,577 planes, representing more than nine years of production.
    • Boeing said yesterday it had booked 893 net new airliner orders in 2018 against 806 deliveries; both Airbus and Boeing achieved record production levels and their combined 1,606 planes handed over was a new high for the commercial airliner industry.
    • Airbus Commercial Aircraft President Guillaume Faury, who will take over as CEO in April, says the order intake "shows the underlying strength of the commercial aircraft."
    • Faury also says the company's factory problems are easing, no longer facing lines of semi-finished jets waiting for engines, in a turnaround from delays caused by a shortfall in the delivery of engines during the last two years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • DBD

    Diebold Nixdorf leads technology gainers; FTE Networks and CLPS among losers

    • Gainers: Diebold Nixdorf (NYSE:DBD) +32%. Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) +18%. Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) +14%. BroadVision (NASDAQ:BVSN) +13%. Opera (NASDAQ:OPRA) +12%.
    • Losers: SMART Global Holdings (NASDAQ:SGH) -26%. VirnetX Holding (NYSEMKT:VHC) -22%. CLPS (NASDAQ:CLPS) -17%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -11%. Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD demos 7nm gaming GPU

    • AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) slides 1.8% after its #CES19 keynote, which featured 7nm products:
    • Gaming GPU: The high-end gaming GPU Radeon VII is meant to take on Nvidia's (NVDA +1.5%) RTX 2080 and features the second-gen Vegas architecture that AMD says offers 25% better performance at the same power as prior models. Other specs: 60 compute units, 3840 stream processors running at up to 1.8GHz, 16GB of HBM2 memory, 1 TB/s memory bandwidth.
    • Price and availability: $699, February 7.
    • Ryzen updates: Ryzen gets a second-gen Mobile processor and the new 7nm third-gen desktop processor. The latter is built on AMD's Zen 2 x86 core and the company demoed it against Intel's i9-9900K processor, saying AMD's product offers comparable rendering performance with 30% less power. The third-gen Ryzen will be available in mid-2019.
    • Epyc update: AMD's "Rome" datacenter CPU is based on the Zen 2 core and was demoed as a single pre-production processor against two of Intel's Xeon Platinum 8180 processors with AMD claiming 15% better performance. Rome will start shipping in mid-2019.
    • In a followup CNBC interview (video link), Su says AMD has seen a bit of a China slowdown and that cloud provider demand has been "bumpy," but the company expects good growth in the coming years.
    • Update: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang calls AMD's Ryzen VII demonstration "underwhelming" with weak performance compared to the GeForce RTX 2060 unveiled on Sunday.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 561 Comments
  • PCG

    PG&E rebounds 9% as new California governor hints at plan

    • PG&E (PCG +8.8%) enjoys a bounce after plunging 28% during the previous two days, as new California Gov. Newsom signals he will deal with the company's problems as one of his first tasks in office.
    • In his only public comments on the company since his inauguration, Newsom said yesterday that he is working on PG&E “in real time” and is in talks with state energy regulators, members of the previous administration and incoming staff “to address the solvency” of the utility.
    • While declining to offer specifics about what he may do for PG&E, Newsom said California needs a “healthy” utility that is able to invest in the future.
    • “We believe California leadership understands the broader translation of higher cost of capital to ratepayers is likely worse via a bankruptcy rather than a tangible financing solution for current wildfire liabilities, based on Governor Newsom’s comments yesterday,” writes BAML analyst Julien Dumoulin-Smith, who reiterates his Buy rating on the stock.
    • But in an indication of spreading concerns about a bankruptcy filing, two small natural gas suppliers have restricted sales to PG&E out of concern that the utility would be unable to pay them, Bloomberg reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 10 Comments
  • DPZ

    Oppenheimer sees buying opportunity with Domino's Pizza

    • Oppenheimer calls the 20% pullback in Domino's Pizza (DPZ +2.5%) a "highly attractive" buying opportunity.
    • "We believe DPZ remains uniquely positioned to surprise with sustained market share gains and drive best-in-class system sales growth. And with more “normalized” Street estimates into ’19 and beyond, we believe DPZ has the ability to outperform consensus," writes Brian Bittner and team.
    • The firm adjusts its price target on DPZ to $280.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme presents 2019 outlook at JPM19; shares up 2%

    • Halozyme (HALO +1.6%) President & CEO Dr. Helen Torley updates investors on 2019 key events and objectives at JPM19. Highlights:
    • FDA action date this quarter for subcutaneous (SC) formulation of Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY +0.4%) Herceptin (trastuzumab), an ENHANZE partner (Genentech).
    • In H2, ENHANZE partner Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -0.5%) (Janssen Biotech) will file a U.S. marketing application for SC formulation of Darzalex (daratumumab).
    • By year-end, three ENHANZE programs will be in Phase 3 development.
    • Company expects to generate $1B in royalty revenue in 2027. Lifetime milestones related to existing ENHANZE partnerships should hit $1B, with $225M - 300M expected in the next three years.
    • Topline data from its Phase 3 study of PEGPH20 in pancreatic cancer expected in H2.
    • Financial guidance: revenue: $175M - 185M; operating expenses: $265M - 275M; cash consumption: $75M - 85M; debt repayment: ~$90M; year-end cash balance: $180M - 190M.
    • Q4 2018 results will be released on February 21.
    • #JPM19
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • SAEX

    SAExploration and Covia among Energy/Materials gainers; Pretium Resources and Yield10 Bioscience among losers

    • Gainers: SAExploration (NASDAQ:SAEX) +63%. Covia (NYSE:CVIA) +19%. New Concept Energy (NYSEMKT:GBR) +15%. Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) +13%. ION Geophysical (NYSE:IO) +11%.
    • Losers: Pretium Resources (NYSE:PVG) -11%. Yield10 Bioscience (NASDAQ:YTEN) -8%. Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS) -7%. Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) -7%. Antero Midstream Partners (NYSE:AM) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 13 Comments
  • BRKL

    Brookline Bancorp -4.2% after Compass point downgrades on headwinds

    • Brookline Bancorp (NASDAQ:BRKL) slumps 4.2% after Compass Point analyst Laurie Havener Hunsicker cuts the bank's rating to neutral from buy and price target to $14 from $20.
    • Concern over sluggish loan growth, difficult yield-curve environment, and economic slowdown poses broader headwinds for the sector.
    • BRKL remains on Compass Point's Takeout List, but lower M&A pricing reduces chances that the company will sell soon, she says.
    • On the plus side, BRKL offers an attractive dividend yield of 2.9% and has a $10M buyback plan.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Analyst ratings: 3 buys; 2 holds; 0 underperform/sells.
    • Previously: Brookline Bancorp approves stock repurchase program (Dec. 6, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • VIVHY

    Report: France's Canal Plus plans spring launch of Netflix rival

    • France's Canal Plus (VIVHY +1.5%) will relaunch its Canal Play streaming service to better compete with Netflix (NFLX -0.3%) there, Les Echos reports.
    • The service will launch this spring (possibly under a new name), according to the report, and will be priced at a Netflix-equivalent €10/month.
    • The new service will reportedly target young people with a focus on series and documentaries.
    • Netflix has more than 3.5M subscribers in France, Les Echos notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 6 Comments
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center sues Vintage Capital right back

    • Rent-A-Center (RCII +0.5%) files a lawsuit against Vintage Capital in order to recover a $126.5M breakup attached to the merger deal.
    • The company says it's due the fee because Vintage didn't properly ask to extend its offer past the deadline that was set.
    • The legal action is a countersuit after Vintage sued Rent-A-Center last month for backing out of the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • TWTR

    Twitter to stream single-player view on NBA games

    • Twitter (TWTR +1%) has a new live-streaming deal with the NBA, with a wrinkle.
    • The company is partnering with the basketball league and Turner Sports (T -2.3%) to stream the second halves of 20 games appearing on TNT -- but the feed will just have a camera focused on a single player, who will be chosen by a Twitter vote.
    • That's apparently part of an approach to complement rather than cannibalize the standard TNT TV audience.
    • “We’re taking live content and expanding its footprint,” says Twitter's content partnership head Kay Madati. “We’re not here to encroach on the rights of our partners."
    • Those streams will debut during the Feb. 17 NBA All-Star Game, followed by a schedule of regular-season and playoff live streams.
    • In more WarnerMedia partnering, Twitter will also bring back a Game of Thrones aftershow from Bill Simmons' The Ringer, and add a Ringer aftershow for season 2 of HBO's Big Little Lies.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 27 Comments
  • WINS

    Wins Finance Holdings leads financial gainers; CyrusOne and Digital Realty Trust among losers

    • Gainers: Wins Finance Holdings (NASDAQ:WINS) +126%. X Financial (NYSE:XYF) +8%. Yintech Investment Holdings (NASDAQ:YIN) +7%. On Deck Capital (NYSE:ONDK) +6%. CURO Group Holdings (NYSE:CURO) +6%.
    • Losers: 360 Finance (NASDAQ:QFIN) -8%. MoneyGram International (NYSE:MGI) -7%. Digital Realty Trust (NYSE:DLR) -5%. Cedar Realty Trust (NYSE:CDR) -5%. CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • TGT

    Target gains again ahead of huge holiday sales report

    • Target (NYSE:TGT) is up another 1.6% today as investors continue to anticipate that they will hear good news when the retailer reports on holiday sales tomorrow morning before the market opens.
    • Last year, Target also preannounced Q4 results along with its update on holiday sales.
    • Credit Suisse analyst Seth Sigman thinks Target needs to deliver holiday comparable sales growth of 5% or better to meet expectations and set Q4 EPS guidance on the high end of the implied range of $1.43 to $1.63.
    • Shares of Target are up almost 8% over the last week off the holiday buzz.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 31 Comments

  • Micron upgrade drives semis higher

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) gains 1.6% as CES 2019 continues and chip stocks get a boost from Bernstein's Micron upgrade as the firm expects a faster memory recovery.
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is up 2.8%, the S&P 500 IT Index gains 0.7%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 is up 1%.
    • Related semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 2 Comments

    Medtronic execs buy shares

    • Medtronic (MDT +2.4%) EVP & CFO Karen Parkhill has filed a Form 4 disclosing the purchase of 3K common shares at $83.87.
    • Chairman & CEO Omar Ishrak purchased 12K shares at $84.045.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 14 Comments

  • CELTF

    Centamin -4% as 2018 gold production plunges 13%

    • Centamin (OTCPK:CELTF -4.1%) shares sink after reporting full-year 2018 production fell 13% Y/Y at its Sukari gold mine in Egypt to more than 472K oz. due to disruptions and lower grades at the operation.
    • Q4 production totaled 137K oz., up 17% Q/Q due to higher grades but down 11% from the year-ago quarter.
    • Centamin warned last month that it would miss Q4 guidance of 145K oz. of gold, but the miner expected only a 2% decline to 480K oz. for the year.
    • The company says it faced several operational challenges during 2018, including lower grades delivered from the open pit in H1, a disruption to the underground stoping sequence in Q2 due to a damaged rig, and unplanned dilution from the cascading stopes in the Amun underground.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple's Services decline temporary, says bull

    • Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty, a long-standing bull of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Services, says the revenue slowdown in the division last quarter looks "temporarily in nature."
    • Services revenue rose 18.3% Y/Y in Q1, down from the 25% growth in the prior quarter. Huberty attributes as much as $425M of the estimated $600M shortfall to AppleCare, which would decline along with iPhone sales.
    • Apple shares are up 2% to $154.09.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 65 Comments
  • KNDI

    Kandi Technologies leads consumer gainers; Constellation Brands and Orchids Paper Products among losers

    • Gainers: Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ:KNDI) +16%. Eastman Kodak Company (NYSE:KODK) +12%. Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) +8%. Funko (NASDAQ:FNKO) +6%. Veoneer (NYSE:VNE) +6%.

    | 12:02 PM
  • UAL

    Imperial Capital negative on United Continental

    • Imperial Capital lowers United Continental (UAL +0.4%) to an In-Line rating after having the airline stock flying with an Outperform rating.
    • Analyst Michael Derchin and team lower the price target on UAL to $73 from $110 on the expectation that the United valuation premium compared to peers will sag as revenue momentum slows.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • BRS

    Bristow's deal for Columbia Helicopters opposed by activist investor

    • Bristow (BRS -3.4%) is lower after activist investor Global Value Investment comes out against the proposed financing of the company's planned acquisition of Columbia Helicopters.
    • Under the proposed financing, Global Value estimates that 33M-33.5M BRS shares would be issued in order to consummate the acquisition, representing a 93% dilution.
    • Global Value believes BRS trades at a steep discount to the company's intrinsic value and that several strategic alternatives exist to unlock shareholder value.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 15 Comments
  • MXL

    MaxLinear +3.5% on Intel collab

    • MaxLinear (NYSE:MXL) announces it's working with Intel and cable industry leaders including Charter and Comcast on a new line of 10 Gigabit ready gateway platforms for the home
    • The platforms will support 10 Gigabit Full Duplex DOCSIS 3.1 for multi-gigabit upload and download speeds.
    • MaxLinear is developing a new front-end SoC that will include high-speed connectivity to Intel's next-gen gateway SoC.
    • Market timing and performance targets of the chipset are aligned with major cable operators and cable modem hardware vendors and the design concepts are in trials with those companies.
    • Samples of the MaxLinear chips are expected in the second half of the year with mass production following in 2020.
    • MXL shares are up 3.5% to $17.78.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • VOD

    Vodafone -2.4% as Macquarie notes German market risks

    • Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) is off 2.4% as Macquarie warns on risks in the German market tied to "populism and politics."
    • Analyst Guy Peddy says Vodafone is "particularly exposed" in Germany "with the subtle shift in populist and political focus to mobile and the delivery of connectivity along travel routes and given Deutsche Telekom’s network lead and the opportunities for Fixed-Wireless Access." (h/t Bloomberg)
    • With auctions in Germany and the UK ahead, cash flow pressures are set to grow, he writes.
    • The firm rates Vodafone at Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 25 Comments
  • ATOS

    Atossa Genetics leads healthcare gainers; Microbot Medical and Axsome Therapeutics among losers

    • Gainers: Atossa Genetics (NASDAQ:ATOS) +48%. La Jolla Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:LJPC) +15%. Globus Medical (NYSE:GMED) +13%. Selecta Biosciences (NASDAQ:SELB) +12%.  Motus GI Holdings (NASDAQ:MOTS) +11%.
    • Losers: Regional Health Properties (NYSEMKT:RHE) -23%. Axsome Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AXSM) -14%. Melinta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MLNT) -13%. Microbot Medical (NASDAQ:MBOT) -13%. Daxor (NYSEMKT:DXR) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • CROX

  • Trio of Fed doves sends dollar lower

    • The Federal Reserve's Jim Bullard, Raphael Bostic, and Charles Evans are all on the tape this morning more or less promising at least a pause in the central bank's rate-hike cycle.
    • Bullard and Evans have been among the more dovish on the Fed of late, so their remarks shouldn't be of too much surprise (both vote on the FOMC this year). Bostic (not a voter this year) leans more centrist. What he's saying: "I see little need to engage in restrictive monetary policy and push the federal funds rate above a neutral stance."

  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel +5% after Q1 earnings beat, higher ferrous sales volumes

    • Schnitzer Steel (NASDAQ:SCHN) +5.1% pre-market after reporting better than expected FQ1 earnings and a 17% Y/Y increase in revenues to $564M.
    • SCHN says Q1 ferrous sales volumes rose 15% vs. the prior-year quarter, primarily due to stronger domestic demand and commercial initiatives to increase supply flows, but fell 11% Q/Q, primarily due to seasonality; nonferrous sales volumes rose 18% Y/Y, mainly due to higher supply flows, but fell 8% Q/Q, primarily due to seasonality.
    • Average ferrous net selling prices rose 5%, or $14/ton, from the prior-year quarter, while falling 5%, or $15/ton, sequentially; average nonferrous net selling prices fell 19% Y/Y and fell 14% Q/Q.
    • "In challenging market conditions that saw a significant decline in the net selling prices for our nonferrous products, AMR delivered solid operating performance with significant year-over-year improvement in ferrous and nonferrous volumes," the company says.

    Tim Cook discusses Apple's focus and future

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is pointing to a higher open this morning as CEO Tim Cook shared why he is optimistic about the tech giant's future.
